kid verb [I/T]
(JOKE)
to say something as a joke, often making someone believe something that is not true: [ I ] You’re kidding around, aren’t you? [ T ] Casey’s just kidding you. kid yourself
If you kid yourself, you believe that something you want to be true is true although it probably is not: He thinks she’ll come back, but I think he’s kidding himself.
